body:
So this is something that is not very important bit would be pretty cool to see.  Who else would like to be able to type a cool message when requesting to friend someone on the website similar to Skype.  However, just like Skype, there would already be a pre-written message just in case someone does not feel very creative.
Once again, this is not a very important feature but would be pretty cool to have

title: Creative Friend Request Feature

replies.body: Maybe it could be a donor feature
replies.body_tagged: Maybe it could be a donor feature

replies.body: You could send friend request messages with malicious links, rude messages, etc.
replies.body_tagged: You could send friend request messages with malicious links, rude messages, etc.

replies.body: there would probably be rules and disclaimers that try to prevent that

replies.body: Last time we had a filter, it worked terribly. If somebody said something along the lines of "push it" it'd end up being censored into "pu** **". If we do implement a filter, it should work better than last time.

replies.body: For those that are saying that this feature could easily be abused, one might argue that the same could be said about the private message on the in game chat.  The best thing that you should do if you received an inappropriate friendship message is to screenshot and report so that player can have this feature taken away from him, similar to a forum ban
